title: My Life in Pullman
name: My Life in Pullman
description:
A Map by Youowemegum

Places over the years on the palouse...

properties.name: 840 SE Sunnymead
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum pullman, waHome from 1993-2005

properties.name: A Sharp Turn
properties.description: Posted by YouowemegumI am reasonably sure this is the curve in the road where I spun out my friend\'s car, many years ago. No one was hurt, just collided with some dirt. LOL.... this led to us calling her car "dirtbag".

properties.name: Denny's
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum The only place in town to go hang out after 2am. Many a strange conversation was had here... many a joke been born. "Keep your hands out of my flate."

properties.name: Kamiak Butte
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum That thing that sticks up on the horizon above all the other hills in Pullman... you know, the big one to the North. Best view: coming down Spring Street. A fun short jaunt to the top, and overlooks all the palouse. Look west and see Steptoe Butte, look east to Moscow Mountain, look south, see Pullman and the Charlie Brown water tower... beyond to the south, see the edge of the Columbia River Plateau... just take it all in. Also, a good place to get married. (Abby and Brady)

properties.name: Lawson Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum  A generous man in the community donated this beautiful park. He was also generous to my family and church, so I mention him. However, there have been stories told about a particular parking space that always seems to draw people towards it... that\'s all I have to say about that.

properties.name: Nuclear Power Plant
properties.description: Posted by YouowemegumFor late night talks with friends... the place to park, sit and watch the stars... or the lightning storms. Just watch out for camp sec....

properties.name: Old Franklin Elementary
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum Where I went to 4th and 5th grade... It was the first schools in town... Is located on "Pioneer Hill", you can look across to the next hill and see Sunnyside Elementary, if you stand in the right spot. By far the best place to go swing and reminisce with old friends. If only they still had the old splinter factory forts..... ah memories.

properties.name: Pullman High School
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum   Pullman High School -- designed by someone who smoked a lot of something in the 60s-70s... and lived in California. Pullman does not have sunshine most of the year... why would you create outdoor hallways? Also... looks a bit like a prison. Good job.

properties.name: Pullman Presbyterian Church
properties.description: Posted by YouowemegumMy extended family from 1990-2005. I still visit when I can. I was there before the sanctuary was... it used to have even more impressive rose gardens than now! But, the sanctuary is really beautiful.

properties.name: Pullman, Washington
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegumpullman, waWhere WSU is located, for anybody who isn\'t from there.

properties.name: Rico's Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum   The town hangout for anyone over 21. Where Pullman High School Alumni run into their old Teachers....

properties.name: Steptoe Butte
properties.description: Posted by YouowemegumA giant prehistoric volcanic mound in the middle of nowhere that you can now drive to the top of and look back at Kamiak Butte, or west to some mountains.... way way off in the distance.

properties.name: Sunnyside Park
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum  The best place in town to go get a noise violation at 12am, or to go feed the ducks, look for turtles, have a picnic, toss around a frisbee, go for a stroll, read Harry Potter on a warm and sunny afternoon... watch the clouds roll in, play on the swings or merry-go-round. Also home of the July 4th Fireworks, when it is best to ford the stream instead of waiting to cross on the foot bridge...

properties.name: Swilly's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum The best desserts in town. Oh God... mmmm.

properties.name: The Daily Grind
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum   Coffee house extraordinare... the town hang out for anyone under 21, or before 10pm.

properties.name: The Dunes
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum Sand Dunes...great for land surfing... harder to access now that the road across the Dam is closed. Used to be a short 45 min drive from Ptown... Shallow part of the river, great for swimming. I lost my sunglasses in the water here once. My same friend who hates to swim found them again. Go figure.

properties.name: Wawawai Park
properties.description: Posted by Youowemegum Ah the pleasant and longer drive than we always remember, windy road down to the river... well.. one way at least. Nice little Park down there. An old friend once tried swimming across the river in his jeans. He didn\'t like to swim... and didn\'t get very far before coming back to shore. Crazy times.

properties.name: Where Ronnie and I almost died
properties.description: Posted by YouowemegumDriving back to ptown in January without traction on my tires at 3am in a fresh snowstorm.... bad idea. Luckily, I managed to stay on the road.
